greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of primes in interval (A194598(n), A164368(n)).
comment: Theorem. If the sequence is unbounded, then there exist arbitrarily long sequences of consecutive primes p_k, p_(k+1),...,p_m such that every interval (p_i/2, p_(i+1)/2), i=k,k+1,...,m-1, contains a prime.
link: V. Shevelev, Ramanujan and Labos primes, their generalizations, and classifications of primes, J. Integer Seq. 15 (2012) Article 12.5.4.
results.author: _Vladimir Shevelev_, Apr 28 2012
